org.deidentifier.arx.masking

Class MatchAndReplaceStringMasker

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.deidentifier.arx.masking.AbstractDictionaryMasker<T>
      • org.deidentifier.arx.masking.AbstractInstBasedDictMasker<java.lang.String>
        • org.deidentifier.arx.masking.MatchAndReplaceStringMasker
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IDictionaryMasker<java.lang.String>, IInstanceMasker<java.lang.String>

    public class MatchAndReplaceStringMasker
extends AbstractInstBasedDictMasker<java.lang.String>
    A masker that tries to find matches in the input strings using a given regex pattern and replaces found matches with a user-specified replacement string.

    It is possible to either replace all matches or only the first, leftmost one. Instead of replacing the whole match with the replacement string, it is also possible to replace each character position in the match repeatedly with the same replacement string.

    Examples:

     // A masker replacing all sequences of lower-case letters with "___":
 MatchAndReplaceStringMasker lowerCaseMasker = new MatchAndReplaceStringMasker(
                "\p{javaLowerCase}+",   // Regex: One or more (unicode) lower-case letters. 
                "___");
  
 // A masker that stars out the first 5 letters of the input:
 MatchAndReplaceStringMasker starMasker = new MatchAndReplaceStringMasker(
                "^.{0,5}",      // Regex: At least zero and up to 5 occurrences of any character, but only if it occurs at the beginning. 
                "*",            // Replacement string.
                true,           // Replace all matches.
                true);          // Replace each character in the match.

    • Constructor Detail

      • MatchAndReplaceStringMasker

        public MatchAndReplaceStringMasker(java.lang.String regEx,
                           java.lang.String replacementString)
                            throws java.util.regex.PatternSyntaxException
        Compiles the given regex string and constructs a new masker using the compiled pattern. The masker will replace all matches of the given regex pattern in the input strings with the replacement string.
        Parameters:
        regEx - The string to be compiled into a regex pattern.
        replacementString - The string by which the masker will replace all matches.
        Throws:
        java.util.regex.PatternSyntaxException - if compilation of the regex string fails.

      • MatchAndReplaceStringMasker

        public MatchAndReplaceStringMasker(java.lang.String regEx,
                           java.lang.String replacementString,
                           boolean replaceAllMatches,
                           boolean replaceEachCharacter)
        Compiles the given regex string and constructs a new masker using the compiled pattern.
        Parameters:
        regEx - The string to be compiled into a regex pattern.
        replacementString - The string by which the masker will replace the first or all matches.
        replaceAllMatches - True if only the first (i.e. leftmost) match of the regular expression should be replaced.
        replaceEachCharacter - True if each single character of the found matches should be replaced by the replacement string.
        Throws:
        java.util.regex.PatternSyntaxException - if compilation of the regex string fails.

      • MatchAndReplaceStringMasker

        public MatchAndReplaceStringMasker(java.util.regex.Pattern regEx,
                           java.lang.String replacementString,
                           boolean replaceAllMatches,
                           boolean replaceEachCharacter)
        Creates a new masker using the given pattern.
        Parameters:
        regEx - The regex pattern used to find matches in the input strings.
        replacementString - The string by which the masker will replace the first or all matches.
        replaceAllMatches - True if only the first (i.e. leftmost) match of the regular expression should be replaced.
        replaceEachCharacter - True if each single character of the found matches should be replaced by the replacement string.

    • Method Detail

      • mask

        public java.lang.String mask(java.lang.String input)
        Masks the given string by trying to match a regex pattern in it. If a match is found, the masking is applied using the rules specified by the masker's current state. If no match is found, the input is returned unchanged.
        Parameters:
        input - The data instance to be masked.
        Returns:
        The masked data.
